title: Honeycutt ready to guide Dodgers staff
subtitle: Honeycutt ready to guide Dodgers staff
body: LOS ANGELES -- In the credential department, new Dodgers pitching coach Rick Honeycutt lacks very little. "There isn't a pitcher on this staff who is in a position that I haven't been in," said Honeycutt. "I was a starter and a reliever. I had good years and bad. I can feel their pain." That's figuratively and literally, because Honeycutt also had to battle back from arm injuries during a remarkable 21-season playing career. Ken Gurnick is a reporter for MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Ken Gurnick
